params.name: parent
params.desc: The parent page or database where the new page is inserted, represented as a JSON object with a `page_id` or `database_id` key, and the corresponding ID.

params.name: properties
params.desc: The values of the pageâ€™s properties. If the `parent` is a database, then the schema must match the parent databaseâ€™s properties. If the `parent` is a page, then the only valid object key is `title`.

params.name: children
params.desc: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

params.name: icon
params.desc: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

params.name: cover
params.desc: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

codes.name: Notion SDK for JavaScript

doc.title: Create a page
doc.body:
[block:callout]
{
  "type": "success",
  "title": "Creates a new page that is a child of an existing page.",
  "body": "`title` is the only valid property in the `properties` body param."
}
[/block]

[block:callout]
{
  "type": "success",
  "title": "Creates a new page that is a child of an existing database.",
  "body": "The keys of the `properties` object body param must match the parent [database's properties](https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-object)."
}
[/block]

[block:callout]
{
  "type": "success",
  "title": "Returns the new [page object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/page)."
}
[/block]

[block:callout]
{
  "type": "warning",
  "title": "Some page `properties` are not supported via the API.",
  "body": "A request body that includes `rollup`, `created_by`, `created_time`, `last_edited_by`, or `last_edited_time` values in the properties object returns an error. These Notion-generated values cannot be created or updated via the API. If the `parent` contains any of these properties, then the new pageâ€™s corresponding values are automatically created."
}
[/block]

[block:callout]
{
  "type": "info",
  "title": "Requirements",
  "body": "Your integration must have [update content capabilities](https://developers.notion.com/reference/capabilities#content-capabilities) on the target parent page or database in order to call this endpoint. \n\nAttempting a query without update content capabilities returns an HTTP response with a 403 status code."
}
[/block]

meta.description: Connect Notion pages and databases to the tools you use every day, creating powerful workflows.
meta.title: Create a page

parent.description: The parent page or database where the new page is inserted, represented as a JSON object with a `page_id` or `database_id` key, and the corresponding ID.

properties.description: The values of the pageâ€™s properties. If the `parent` is a database, then the schema must match the parent databaseâ€™s properties. If the `parent` is a page, then the only valid object key is `title`.

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

message.example: Could not find page with ID: 4cc3b486-0b48-4cfe-8ce9-67c47100eb6a. Make sure the relevant pages and databases are shared with your integration.
You have been rate limited. Please try again in a few minutes.
